revised_title: Researches on Tides: Twelfth Series - On the Laws of the Rise and Fall of the Sea's Surface during Each Tide
tldr: The author investigates the rate of rise and fall of tidal surfaces at various locations, including Plymouth, Liverpool, and Bristol, and develops a mathematical model to explain the observed patterns. The study reveals that the height of the water at a given place increases nearly as the sine of the time, while the time increases as the arc. The findings have implications for navigation and the understanding of tidal dynamics.
